metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19075 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.Description: A memory leak in the ca8210_probe() function indrivers/net/ieee802154/ca8210.c in the Linux kernel before 5.3.8 allowsattackers to cause a denial of service (memory consumption) by triggeringca8210_get_platform_data() failures, aka CID-6402939ec86e.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
